duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensuring the delivery of appropriate cancer support and outreach services to customers/patients in accordance with established policies and objectives.
Assisting patients, families, and healthcare providers in accessing cancer care services, resources, and information at Rex.
Maintaining accurate information/materials and responding to educational and support needs based on professional and community assessments.
Monitoring needs for new and existing programs and working closely with other staff, departments, physicians, and service line teams to maintain quality.
Coordinating work assignments, monitoring performance of co-workers and volunteers, and assisting with annual evaluations as needed.
Developing and coordinating oncology support and outreach programs across Rex and the community, in alignment with evidence-based guidelines and in response to community needs.
Conducting presentations related to cancer care and topics to Rex employees and the community at large.
Establishing relationships with internal departments, external practices, and community groups/organizations to coordinate joint efforts that maximize Rex's mission and vision.
Maintaining accurate account of the budget and ordering necessary supplies/materials and special products in accordance with the budget.
Developing and conducting program and grant evaluation and maintaining evaluation documents.

Maintaining knowledge and skills to identify and deliver services/resources for cancer patients, their families, and the community to address informational needs or aid in accessing cancer care services.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in health related field required (Master's preferred)
